name: Ash
description: This is Ash, lethal and elusive. Ash can remain unseen, but his effects on the battlefield can be felt by all. Keep an eye out, Tenno.

passive.description: Slash procs inflicted by Ash's weapons and abilities deal 25% more damage and last 50% longer.

first.name: Shuriken
first.desc: Launches a spinning blade of pain, dealing high damage and impaling enemies to walls.

second.name: Smoke Screen
second.desc: Drops a smoke bomb that stuns enemies and obscures their vision, rendering Ash invisible for a short time.

third.name: Teleport
third.desc: Ash teleports towards the target, bringing him into melee range and making enemies vulnerable to finishers.

fourth.name: Bladestorm
fourth.desc: Project fierce shadow clones of Ash upon groups of distant enemies. Join the fray using Teleport.

name: Atlas
description: This is Atlas, the brawler, the strong. Moving mountains is no easy task, Tenno. Atlas endures.

passive.description: Wielding explosive power and incredible stamina, Atlas strengthens his insurmountable durability through battle. Strong as the mountain, Atlas is immune to Knockdown while in contact with the ground. Rubble is a pickup item unique to Atlas that drops from petrified enemies and Rumblers on death. Rubble restores Health to Atlas if he is injured; if Atlas is at full health, Rubble instead grants additional Armor that decays over time.

first.name: Landslide
first.desc: Bash enemies with an exploding sliding punch, and repeat for a devastating combo. Petrified enemies take extra damage, and drop Rubble when destroyed. Rubble can heal Atlas and bolster his armor.

second.name: Tectonics
second.desc: Summon a rock-wall, activate again to send the rocks crashing towards the enemy.

third.name: Petrify
third.desc: Atlas' hardened gaze will fossilize foes, heal Rumblers, and create Petrified Bulwarks. When shattered, petrified enemies drop healing Rubble for Atlas.

fourth.name: Rumblers
fourth.desc: Summon two elemental stone brawlers to the melee. Summoning petrifies enemies in close proximity to Atlas. When finished, Rumblers collapse into a pile of healing Rubble.

name: Banshee
description: This is Banshee, stealthy and ranged. No one puts Banshee in a corner, Tenno. The element of surprise is in her favor.

passive.description: All of Banshee's equipped weapons, including Gunblades, and weapons equipped on Sentinels should they be present, are treated as silent.

first.name: Sonic Boom
first.desc: Banshee emits a sonic shockwave that pushes targets in range with enough force to incapacitate or kill attackers.

second.name: Sonar
second.desc: Using acoustic location, Banshee's Sonar power finds and tracks enemies, and exposes critical weak spots to everyone in your squad.

third.name: Silence
third.desc: Using Silence surrounds Banshee in an aura that stuns enemies and will limit their perceptions and tactical response to gunfire and Warframe attacks.

fourth.name: Sound Quake
fourth.desc: Channeling all of her acoustic energy into the environment, Banshee uses ultrasonic reverberations to violently shake the ground.

name: Baruuk
description: This is Baruuk, the reluctant warrior. Following the path that winds between peace and hate, he maintains restraint before unleashing the storm within.

passive.description: Baruuk's tolerance for violence wanes as his hand is forced by his foes. Restraint is a resource unique to Baruuk that provides up to 50% Damage Reduction when the meter is completely depleted.

first.name: Elude
first.desc: Dodge all incoming projectiles, but only while not attacking. Use again to deactivate this ability.

second.name: Lull
second.desc: A calming wave slows enemies until they fall into a slumber. Enemies woken by damage will be confused and disoriented. Short-term amnesia means all waking enemies forget anything that happened before the lull.

third.name: Desolate Hands
third.desc: Summon a bevy of orbiting daggers to seek out enemy guns, destroying them with a small explosion. Combine with Elude to double the range.

fourth.name: Serene Storm
fourth.desc: With his Restraint eroded, Baruuk commands the Desert Wind to deliver powerful radial strikes with his fists and feet. Each moment commanding the storm restores his Restraint.

name: Caliban
description: A twisted hybrid of Warframe and Sentient, he is raised in the wreckage of the Old War. This is Caliban, the survivor, the adaptive. Once a weapon consigned by Erra after the Old War, Caliban is yours to sow vengeance in the New.

passive.description: Versatile and resilient, Caliban and allies within his Affinity Range gain Adaptive Armor that builds damage resistance against the highest damage type received from enemy attacks, stacking 5% per hit up to a cap of 50%. If Caliban or his allies do not receive damage for 5 seconds, their Adaptive Armor loses 2% per second until fully removed.

first.name: Razor Gyre
first.desc: Become a spinning vortex of death. Hold to accelerate the maelstrom, increasing damage or target an enemy by tapping to dash toward them. Hitting enemies inflicted with Sentient Wrath creates a destructive blast

second.name: Sentient Wrath
second.desc: Smash the ground sending out a radial wave of destruction. Those not killed by the initial blast are helplessly lifted into the air, where they take amplified damage for a short time.

third.name: Lethal Progeny
third.desc: Call on Caliban's Sentient aspect to produce up three Conculyst comrades to fight by his side, and repair his shields.

fourth.name: Fusion Strike
fourth.desc: Converge three streams of raw energy upon a single point, causing a massive reactive blast. The fallout from the blast will strip the armor and shields from all enemies that touch it.

name: Chroma
description: This is Chroma, an ancient legend, master of the elements. When all the land is in ruins, Tenno, only Chroma will remain.

passive.description: Chroma possesses an extra midair jump and bullet jump. Wings matching Chroma's energy colors will form during these maneuvers. Chroma can alter his abilities to match any basic (uncombined) elemental attribute of the player's choice. Customizing Chroma's primary emission color determines what abilities he starts with.

first.name: Spectral Scream
first.desc: Exhale a deep breath of elemental destruction. Chroma's energy color determines the element.

second.name: Elemental Ward
second.desc: Depending on Chroma's elemental alignment, an offensive area-of-effect is created. Chroma and his nearby allies are imbued with defensive energy.

third.name: Vex Armor
third.desc: When shields are hit, Chroma's armor grows stronger, when health takes a hit, weapon damage increases. Active for a limited time, maximum increases correspond to rank.

fourth.name: Effigy
fourth.desc: Chroma turns his pelt into a massive sentry that strengthens nearby allies and engulfs enemies in elemental attacks.

name: Citrine
description: Glisten bright with gemstone purity and become bejeweled in adamant amber. Revealed by luminous lustre, witness her pristine beauty as the Crystal Bastion, Citrine, ascends from the cavernous unknown.

passive.description: Bask in her glamorous glow that rivals life-nurturing sunlight. Citrine emits a healing aura within a radius of 50 meters, granting the Geoluminesence buff to herself and allies that continuously recover a base 5 Health points per second.

first.name: Fractured Blast
first.desc: Slash and stagger enemies with a crystal blast that inflicts Bleed. Enemies afflicted with this Status Effect have an increase chance of dropping Health and Energy Orbs.

second.name: Preserving Shell
second.desc: Citrine guards herself and nearby allies with a crystalline shell that gradually decays. Kills and assists increase the defensive power of the shell.

third.name: Prismatic Gem
third.desc: Deploy a gem that shoots prismatic beams. The gem targets enemies that are taking weapon damage from Citrine and her allies. Its beams inflict Heat, Cold, Toxin, and Electricity Status Effects. Status Chance and Status Duration increase for nearby allies.

fourth.name: Crystallize
fourth.desc: Citrine summons crystal fractals. The fractals rush forward, seeking enemies. Enemies touched by the fractals are paralyzed crystalline growths. Hit the growths to deal Critical Damage.

name: Ember
description: This is Ember, destructive and deadly. Ember's presence on the battlefield is devastating. Mind the heat, Tenno.

passive.description: Reveling in the heat of combat, Ember gains 5% extra Ability Strength for every enemy burning with an active Heat status effect within a 50 meters radius.

first.name: Fireball
first.desc: Charge and release a fiery projectile that ignites enemies on contact.

second.name: Immolation
second.desc: Protect Ember with flame armor that burns stronger over time, consuming energy once its meter is at full strength. Cast again to extinguish the flame.

third.name: Fire Blast
third.desc: Slam the ground to create a wave of incinerating plasma that knocks back enemies and strips their armor.

fourth.name: Inferno
fourth.desc: Command a flaming comet to crash down in front of ember, engulfing enemies with a fire that can spread through their ranks.

name: Equinox
description: This is Equinox, a deadly duality. A true Tenno must master the divide between night and day. Do you have what it takes?

passive.description: When Equinox collects Health Orbs or Energy Orbs, 10% of the restored amount is converted into additional Energy and Health respectively. Equinox can shift between two forms to alter her abilities: the offensive-focused Day-Form or the defensive/supportive-focused Night-Form. Customizing Equinox's primary emission color determines what form she starts with.

first.name: Metamorphosis
first.desc: Switch forms, temporarily gaining bonus shields and armor in Night-Form, or bonus damage and speed in Day-Form.

second.name: Rest & Rage
second.desc: In Night Form targets are put to sleep. In Day Form targets become more vulnerable to damage.

third.name: Pacify & Provoke
third.desc: In Night Form reduces damage inflicted by nearby enemies. In Day Form increases Ability Strength of nearby allies.

fourth.name: Mend & Maim
fourth.desc: In Night Form, allies are healed with each nearby enemy killed. In Day Form, nearby enemies are bled and then subjected to a wave of slashing force.

name: Excalibur
description: This is Excalibur, a master of gun and blade. No matter your style, Tenno, Excalibur is a formidable choice.

passive.description: Excalibur has improved mastery in the Tenno art of the blade, receiving +10% Attack Speed and +10% damage bonuses for melee attacks while wielding the following weapons: Swords, Dual swords, Nikanas, Rapiers, Exalted Blade.

first.name: Slash Dash
first.desc: Dash between enemies while slashing with the Exalted Blade.

second.name: Radial Blind
second.desc: Emits a bright flash of light, blinding all enemies in a small radius for several seconds.

third.name: Radial Javelin
third.desc: Launches javelins towards enemies, dealing high damage and impaling them to walls.

fourth.name: Exalted Blade
fourth.desc: Summon a sword of pure light and immense power.

name: Frost
description: This is Frost, colder and deadlier than space itself. Frost can protect or punish, the decision is yours.

passive.description: Any melee assailant that strikes Frost has a 10% chance to be temporarily frozen for 20 seconds on impact.

first.name: Freeze
first.desc: A frigid energy blast that freezes targets in their tracks.

second.name: Ice Wave
second.desc: Sends a wave of razor sharp, crystallized ice toward an enemy, dealing heavy damage.

third.name: Snow Globe
third.desc: Frost deep freezes any vapor and moisture in the area, creating a protective sphere with brief invulnerability to boost its strength.

fourth.name: Avalanche
fourth.desc: Summons a treacherous landslide of ice that instantly freezes and shatters all enemies in its radius.

name: Gara
description: This is Gara, the unbreakable warrior. Manipulator of glass, she fractures the resolve of her enemies. The shattered remains of her enemies are all that Gara leaves behind. Tread lightly.

passive.description: While standing in light, Gara's glass body has a chance to blind enemies within 12 meters for 10 seconds, exposing them to Melee Finisher attacks.

first.name: Shattered Lash
first.desc: Lash out with stream of shattered glass, or hold for an arcing strike.

second.name: Splinter Storm
second.desc: Gara's armor splinters into a maelstrom of shattered glass that slices enemies and impairs their weapons. Allies who contact the cloud are fortified against damage.

third.name: Spectrorage
third.desc: Trap enemies in a carousel of mirrors, forcing them to attack visions of their true selves. Destroyed mirrors damage their attackers, as does the collapse of the carousel.

fourth.name: Mass Vitrify
fourth.desc: Create an expanding ring of molten glass that slowly crystallizes enemies who enter. When the expansion is complete, the ring hardens to block weapons fire. The ring draws extra strength from the health and shields of crystallized enemies. Use Shattered Lash to smash the ring and send razor-sharp glass flying outward.

name: Garuda
description: This is Garuda, the gore queen. Cleansed by the blood of her enemies, she draws strength from vulnerability.

passive.description: The more Garuda kills the more vicious her attacks become; Garuda gains up to 100% additional damage bonus for her abilities and weapons for each kill or assisted kill.  When no melee weapon is selected in the Arsenal loadout, Garuda Talons become available in the Arsenal screen as an exclusive melee weapon that can be modified separately and equipped for combat during missions.

first.name: Dread Mirror
first.desc: Rip the life force from an enemy and use it as a shield that captures damage. Charge to channel the captured damage into an explosive projectile.

second.name: Blood Altar
second.desc: Impale an enemy on an altar of talons and siphon health for Garuda and her allies.

third.name: Bloodletting
third.desc: Garuda sacrifices her health to generate energy.

fourth.name: Seeking Talons
fourth.desc: Charge to expand the targeting area, release to send Garuda’s talons careening toward each target in area. Surviving enemies are prone to bleeding.

name: Gauss
description: Charging his abilities with every step, he's streamlined for speed. This is Gauss, the runner, the rapid. If the battle seems out of control, Tenno, you're not going fast enough.

passive.description: To achieve supersonic speed, Gauss draws upon both his Energy reserves and his state-of-the-art electrokinetic battery to fuel his abilities. Gauss has access to 80% of the battery in his default state; activating Redline grants access to 100% of the battery. The battery, displayed as a gauge meter above his ability icons, acts as a secondary resource that charges or drains depending on the ability he uses.

first.name: Mach Rush
first.desc: Burst into a hyper-sprint bowling over enemies and charging the battery. Crashing into solid objects generates a powerful shockwave. Hold to rush continuously.

second.name: Kinetic Plating
second.desc: Generate armor plating that converts a portion of absorbed Kinetic Damage (Physical, Heat, Cold, and Blast) into Energy. Also protects Gauss from being staggered or knocked down. Damage Resistance is relative to the battery level.

third.name: Thermal Sunder
third.desc: Siphon kinetic energy from the area, charging the battery and inflicting Cold Status on nearby enemies. Hold reverses the process, draining the battery and inflicting Heat Status on nearby enemies.

fourth.name: Redline
fourth.desc: Push Gauss' battery beyond the redline, supercharging his Abilities and setting Fire Rate, Attack Speed, Reload Speed, and Holster Rate into overdrive. When past the redline, bolts of arcing electricity dance periodically from Gauss, exploding en masse when the ability is deactivated.

name: Grendel
description: Feasting on enemies like his own personal buffet, his hunger for battle is primal. This is Grendel, the devourer, the insatiable. Dinner is best served with a side of mayhem. Bon appétit, Tenno.

passive.description: Devouring his prey whole, Grendel slowly digests the enemies he swallows via Feast. Each enemy still alive in Grendel's belly passively grants him 250 Armor, to a maximum of 1,250 bonus armor at the 5 enemy cap.

first.name: Feast
first.desc: Swallow an enemy whole and store it in Grendel’s gut. Hold to vomit out stored enemies covering them in toxic bile.

second.name: Nourish
second.desc: Regenerate health as Grendel absorbs nourishment from enemies in his gut. While he digests, enemies that attack or are attacked by Grendel suffer Viral Damage and energy sources provide more energy. These buffs extend to squad mates.

third.name: Pulverize
third.desc: Grendel curls into a ball. He heals over time as he rolls, knocking over anyone in his path. Jumping slams Grendel into the ground and generates a damaging shockwave.

fourth.name: Regurgitate
fourth.desc: Violently puke out a bile soaked enemy from Grendel’s gut, turning the consumed into a toxic projectile.

name: Gyre
description: Graceful in every step with clockwork precision, her mechanized pirouette captivates the audience in electrifying shock and awe. Execute and electrocute elegantly as Gyre, the dancing spark.

passive.description: Gyre's abilities gain a flat 10% Critical Chance per active Electricity status proc affecting an individual enemy to deal 2.0x Critical Damage against that enemy.

first.name: Arcsphere
first.desc: Launch a Gyratory Sphere that will deal high damage on impact and periodically deal electrical shocks to nearby enemies. Hit multiple enemies at once with the initial launch to enhance damage.

second.name: Coil Horizon
second.desc: Throw forward a Gyratory Sphere that will implode after a few seconds or can be manually triggered.

third.name: Cathode Grace
third.desc: Gain a brief burst of increased Critical Chance and Energy Regen, with each kill extending duration of Cathode Grace. Casting is on a cooldown.

fourth.name: Rotorswell
fourth.desc: Gyre’s mechanisms spin at incredible speeds, generating an Electric Field that shocks nearby enemies. When Gyre gets a critical hit, a large electrical discharge will chain from the enemy that was hit to nearby enemies.

name: Harrow
description: This is Harrow, the monastic, the ritualist. Harrow is suffragan to the Void. Will you believe, Tenno?

passive.description: Harrow possesses 200% Overshields capacity, granting him a maximum of 2,400 Overshields, and spawns into missions with 100% Energy filled.

first.name: Condemn
first.desc: Cast a wave of energy that chains them where they stand. Each enemy held reinforces Harrow’s shields.

second.name: Penance
second.desc: Sacrifice shields to boost reload, and fire rate while converting damage inflicted on enemies into health for Harrow and nearby allies.

third.name: Thurible
third.desc: Channel Harrow’s energy into the Thurible to generate a buff. Once finished, kill enemies to bestow nearby allies with bursts of energy. The more energy channeled the greater the reward for each kill. Headshots produce extra energy.

fourth.name: Covenant
fourth.desc: Protect nearby allies with an energy force that absorbs all damage and converts it to a Critical Chance bonus for all those under the Covenant. Headshots are amplified even further.

name: Hildryn
description: Drawing from her shields like a battery, her defensive and offensive utility are unparalleled. This is Hildryn, the domina of armament.

passive.description: Hildryn utilizes her advanced Shielding systems to power all of her abilities. Although she has no Energy capacity, her shields boast additional passive benefits and defensive capabilities.

first.name: Balefire
first.desc: Charge and launch devastating bolts of fire.

second.name: Pillage
second.desc: Pillage a percentage of Shields and Armor of nearby enemies to replenish Hildryn's own Shields and Overshields.

third.name: Haven
third.desc: Create a shield aura around allies. Enemies that approach shielded allies will take damage.

fourth.name: Aegis Storm
fourth.desc: Take the skies and rain Balefire rockets down on the enemy. Nearby enemies are blasted into the air where they will create an Energy Orb every few seconds. When shields run out the enemies are smashed into the ground.

name: Hydroid
description: This is Hydroid, a deadly marauder from the deep. Whether the seas or the stars, Tenno, Hydroid takes a foreboding command of the battlefield.

passive.description: Hydroid's melee slam attacks have a 50% chance to spawn a tentacle that lasts for 15 seconds. The tentacle senses nearby enemies within 5 meters to grab and thrash them, dealing 200 True damage per second bypassing shields and armor; captured enemies are released upon death or tentacle expiring. Up to 3 tentacles spawned by this passive may exist at once.

first.name: Tempest Barrage
first.desc: Target an area and call down a barrage of liquid fury. Charge this attack to increase the lethality of the onslaught.

second.name: Tidal Surge
second.desc: Crash through enemies in a ferocious wall of water.

third.desc: Become a water trap and drown unsuspecting enemies.

fourth.desc: Tap to spawn watery tentacles from all nearby surfaces to wreak havoc. Charge to increase the number of tentacles and spawn area. Use while in Undertow to have the tentacles emerge from the pool.

name: Inaros
description: This is Inaros, the savior, king of the desert. Whether denizens of the sky or the earth, Tenno, the fear of Inaros is within.

passive.description: Resurrect the undying king of the desert with the death of his foes. On fatal injury and entering Bleedout, Inaros enters an immobile Sarcophagus. Within his tomb, target an enemy or ally on the aiming reticle (default LMB ) to release a beam that continuously inflicts 75 True damage per tick and siphon hitpoints from them, gradually filling his revive meter to allow Inaros to rise again. Killing enemies with melee Finishers restores 20% of Inaros' maximum Health.

first.name: Desiccation
first.desc: Blast enemies with a wave of cursed sand that blinds them and steals their health.

second.name: Devour
second.desc: Hold power to trap target in quicksand and draw them in for devouring; this steals health and ultimately creates a friendly Sand Shadow.

third.name: Sandstorm
third.desc: Become a whirling spiral of sand that sends enemies flying and devours those trapped in quicksand.

fourth.name: Scarab Swarm
fourth.desc: Charge to transform health into hardened scarab armor. Discharge to blast enemies with a scarab swarm; survivors have their health drained and bestowed on allies.

name: Ivara
description: This is Ivara, the huntress, the thief. Don't roam around the forest looking for a fight, Tenno. Ivara is always on guard.

passive.description: Ivara has an innate radar that detects enemies within 20 meters and displays their position on the minimap.

first.name: Quiver
first.desc: Cycle through and shoot one of four tactical arrows: Cloak, Dashwire, Noise and Sleep.

second.name: Navigator
second.desc: Assume control of a projectile and guide it to the target.

third.name: Prowl
third.desc: Become invisible and steal loot from unsuspecting enemies or take out prey with deadly headshots.

fourth.name: Artemis Bow
fourth.desc: Summon a mighty bow and unleash a volley of devastating arrows.

name: Khora
description: This is Khora, with bladed precision, she is a mistress of entrapment. Don't get caught on the wrong end of a whipcrack of Khora's steel. It may be the last thing you hear.

passive.description: Khora's ferocious Kavat, Venari, fights alongside her with steadfast zeal. Venari is an exclusive Companion for the Khora Warframe, integrated as her signature passive ability. Venari will spawn beside Khora when the player first enters a mission, as a permanent companion that lasts until killed.

first.name: Whipclaw
first.desc: Send enemies reeling with a deafening whipcrack.

second.name: Ensnare
second.desc: Bind a hapless target in living metal, entangling others who stray too close. Whipclaw will refresh the trap allowing it to capture more enemies.

third.name: Venari
third.desc: Command Venari to focus on a target. Hold to cycle between Attack, Protect, and Heal postures. If Venari is killed, use this ability to revive her instantly.

fourth.name: Strangledome
fourth.desc: Weave a dome of living chain that ensnares and strangles any enemy within, and any foolish enough to approach. Foes outside the trap will try to hasten their comrade's deaths by shooting them. Crack Whipclaw on the dome to further damage any trapped enemies.

name: Lavos
description: Manipulating the laws of the physical realm, his prowess permeates the battlefield. This is Lavos, the transmuter, the elemental craftsman. Lavos harnesses the secret of invention, Tenno. Experimentation is the beauty of science.

passive.description: Purifying himself from all ailments, Lavos cleanses all active negative Status Effects and gains status immunity for 10 seconds upon collecting an Energy or Universal Orb. Lavos can only collect a single Energy or Universal Orb every 5 seconds. Lavos has no energy capacity and his abilities do not use any resource to activate. Instead, each of his abilities are free to cast with a cooldown in between uses. The Ability Efficiency stat will instead affect the cooldown reduction effect from Transmutation Probe.

first.name: Ophidian Bite
first.desc: Lash out with a toxic serpentine strike, consuming the target to heal Lavos. Hold to imbue all abilities with Toxin.

second.name: Vial Rush
second.desc: Dash forward, crashing through enemies and leaving an icy trail of broken vials. Hold to imbue the next ability cast with Cold.

third.name: Transmutation Probe
third.desc: Launch a probe that converts Health and Energy Orbs into Universal Orbs that provide both, and ammo pickups into Universal Ammo Pickups. The probe shocks enemies in close proximity. Each electrocuted foe reduces other ability cooldowns by one second. Hold to imbue the next ability cast with Electricity.

fourth.name: Catalyze
fourth.desc: Catalyst Probes erupt from Lavos and douse combatants in a fiery gel. Damage is doubled for each element afflicting an enemy. Hold to imbue the next ability cast with Heat.

name: Limbo
description: This is Limbo, master of the Rift. In a land of both shadow and substance, Limbo is both nowhere and everywhere.

passive.description: Limbo has access to the Rift plane (Rift for short), an alternate dimension to the normal environment, or material plane. By performing a Roll, a Sidespring, or a Backspring, Limbo slides into and out of the Rift at will. This is better known as Rift Walk. Several of Limbo's abilities impose the Rift upon the world around him, affecting himself, the environment, enemies, and even allies.

first.name: Banish
first.desc: Casts a wave of Rift energy that damages hostiles while pushing enemies and allies out of Limbo’s current plane of existence.

second.name: Stasis
second.desc: Freezes Rift-bound enemies. While active, enemy projectiles are arrested in mid-air, resuming its trajectory when stasis ends.

third.name: Rift Surge
third.desc: Surges nearby Rift-bound enemies with Rift energy. When killed the Rift Surge is transferred to a nearby enemy outside the rift. Surged enemies that leave the Rift perform a radial Banish.

fourth.name: Cataclysm
fourth.desc: A violent blast of void energy tears open a pocket of rift plane which can sustain itself for a short period before collapsing in another lethal blast.

name: Loki
description: This is Loki, the trickster, the deceiver. Whether you prefer to go into battle alone or with a team, Tenno, Loki will adapt to any style.

passive.description: Loki's Wall Latch duration lasts 10 times longer than normal, up to a maximum of 60 seconds.

first.name: Decoy
first.desc: Loki deploys a holographic copy of himself, drawing enemy fire.

second.name: Invisibility
second.desc: Loki camouflages himself, becoming invisible to enemies.

third.name: Switch Teleport
third.desc: Loki instantaneously swaps positions with a target, confusing the enemy.

fourth.name: Radial Disarm
fourth.desc: Lets forth a wave of energy, disrupting the projectile weapons of enemies in range and forcing them to revert to melee combat.

name: Mag
description: This is Mag, a force to be reckoned with. Mag is a team player, Tenno, and a worthy addition to any squad.

passive.description: Mag automatically Vacuums Pickups that are within 8 meters towards her.

first.name: Pull
first.desc: Magnetic force pulls enemies toward you, stunning them and bringing them into melee range.

second.name: Magnetize
second.desc: (TAP) Encloses a target in a magnetic field, ensnaring nearby enemies and dealing damage over time. Bullets and shards created from Polarize increase this damage. (HOLD) Creates a magnetic field around a target, ensnaring nearby enemies and dealing damage over time. The field reacts to bullets and shards created from Polarize to increase the damage.

third.name: Polarize
third.desc: Emit an energy pulse that depletes enemy shields and armor, creating shards which become deadly when mixed with Magnetize. Shields of allies touched by the pulse are restored.

fourth.name: Crush
fourth.desc: Magnetizes the bones of nearby enemies, causing them to collapse upon themselves.

name: Mesa
description: This is Mesa, the vagabond, the outcast. Do you feel lucky, Tenno? Mesa's got the fastest guns in the stars.

passive.description: Mesa has improved proficiency with secondary weapons, and gains a health bonus at the expense of not having a melee weapon equipped. The following are passive bonuses available to Mesa: +15% fire rate with dual wielded sidearms, +25% reload speed for one handed sidearms, +50 health when no melee weapon is equipped.

first.name: Ballistic Battery
first.desc: When activated, this power stores damage caused by guns. When triggered again, that damage is channeled through the next gunshot.

second.name: Shooting Gallery
second.desc: Gives an ally extra damage while jamming the guns of nearby enemies. This power shifts between team members.

third.name: Shatter Shield
third.desc: Envelops Mesa in a barrier of energy, reflecting back incoming bullet damage.

fourth.name: Peacemaker
fourth.desc: With intense focus, Mesa draws her Regulator pistols, shooting down her foes in rapid succession.

name: Mirage
description: This is Mirage, a sly conjurer. Do you believe in magic, Tenno? Mirage's deceiving influence on the battlefield might make you.

passive.description: Mirage has an increased proficiency when performing several Maneuvers. Sliding lasts 85% longer, +50% faster Maneuver speed.

first.name: Hall of Mirrors
first.desc: Mirage creates an entourage of doppelgangers to confuse and distract the enemy.

second.name: Sleight of Hand
second.desc: Booby trap nearby objects while conjuring an irresistible jewel that bursts with radial blind when touched in darkness, or a radial explosion in light. Conjure multiple smaller jewels with the help of Hall of Mirrors.

third.name: Eclipse
third.desc: Standing in light, Mirage deals heavy damage, while the shadows make Mirage difficult to track and even harder to hurt.

fourth.name: Prism
fourth.desc: Fires an energy prism that shoots lasers in all directions. Activating again detonates the prism, blinding nearby foes.

name: Nekros
description: This is Nekros, manipulator of souls. Nekros possesses the battlefield, Tenno. Death is his playground.

passive.description: A master of death, Nekros regenerates 5 points of Health any time an enemy dies within 10 meters of him. His passive also can heal Companions.

first.name: Soul Punch
first.desc: A blow so powerful, it turns the enemy's very soul into a deadly projectile, damaging all in its path.

second.name: Terrify
second.desc: Casts fear into the hearts of nearby enemies, causing them to run away in terror.

third.name: Desecrate
third.desc: Forces fallen enemies around you to drop additional loot.

fourth.name: Shadows of the Dead
fourth.desc: Summons shadow versions of vanquished enemies to fight alongside you for a short period of time.

name: Nezha
description: This is Nezha, the protector, the quick. Feel the heat, Tenno. Nezha is a burning thing, and he makes a fiery ring.

passive.description: Nezha slides 60% faster and goes 35% farther.

first.name: Fire Walker
first.desc: Blaze a trail of flames, scorching enemies and cleansing allies.

second.name: Blazing Chakram
second.desc: Hurl a flaming ring that burns enemies and causes them to emit a healing blast on death. Reactivate to instantly travel to the ring's location.

third.name: Warding Halo
third.desc: Create a protective ring of fire that also stuns and damage enemies who get too close.

fourth.name: Divine Spears
fourth.desc: Impale nearby enemies on spears that erupt from the ground.

name: Nidus
description: This is Nidus, the adaptive, the scourge.Nidus is a deadly plague for which there is no cure. You must control the strange disease.

passive.description: The Infestation dwelling within Nidus mutates rapidly when used against his foes, fueling his abilities and yielding various symbiotic benefits.

first.name: Virulence
first.desc: Rupture the ground with a damaging fungal growth that steals energy from each enemy it strikes. For every five enemies hit, the Infestation mutates, multiplying its destructive force.

second.name: Larva
second.desc: Spawn an Infested pod that erupts with tendrils, latches onto nearby enemies and pulls them in.

third.name: Parasitic Link
third.desc: Bind to a target with a parasitic link. For allies, both the host and Nidus gain increased Ability Strength. Linked enemies take the damage inflicted on Nidus.

fourth.name: Ravenous
fourth.desc: Gluttonous maggots swarm nearby enemies, feasting until they burst with Infestation. The maggots benefit from Mutation and each enemy consumed adds to the Mutation stack.

name: Nova
description: This is Nova, wildly unpredictable. Nova's presence on the battlefield is complex and deadly. Handle with care, Tenno.

passive.description: Whenever Nova is knocked down, she emits a neutron burst which knocks down and damages enemies in a 6 meter radius and deals 250 Blast damage.

first.name: Null Star
first.desc: Creates anti-matter particles that orbit Nova and seek nearby targets.

second.name: Antimatter Drop
second.desc: Launches a contained particle of antimatter that will detonate upon collision.

third.name: Worm Hole
third.desc: Creates a wormhole allowing instantaneous travel.

fourth.name: Molecular Prime
fourth.desc: Primes all enemies in a radius with anti-matter.

name: Nyx
description: This is Nyx, manipulator of minds. On her own or with a group, Nyx can turn the tide of battle in her favor.

passive.description: Enemies are 20% less accurate when targeting Nyx (except while Absorb is active).

first.name: Mind Control
first.desc: Nyx invades the psyche of a target, confusing enemies and making them fight for the Tenno cause.

second.name: Psychic Bolts
second.desc: Nyx launches a cluster of force bolts at enemies, using telekinesis to adjust flight paths and seek nearby targets.

third.name: Chaos
third.desc: With a powerful psychic blast, Nyx causes mass hysteria on the battlefield by confusing all enemies to attack random factions.

fourth.name: Absorb
fourth.desc: Nyx absorbs all incoming damage and channels that collected energy into an explosive radial discharge. Nyx's Weapon damage is buffed based on incoming absorbed damage when the Ability ends.

name: Oberon
description: This is Oberon, the mystic, the willful. Oberon is an adept and honorable warrior, Tenno. Are you?

passive.description: Creatures of nature rejuvenate in Oberon's presence, causing allied Kubrows, Kavats, Predasites, and Vulpaphylas to receive +25% Health, Shield and Armor links. Oberon's own Kubrow, Kavat, Predasite, or Vulpaphyla also receives 1 instant revive per mission.

first.name: Smite
first.desc: Focuses deadly energy within a target and then projects it outwards, damaging both the target and surrounding enemies.

second.name: Hallowed Ground
second.desc: Sanctifies the ground before Oberon with righteous fire, inflicting damage to any enemy that stands in the flames.

third.name: Renewal
third.desc: Healing waves of energy flow outward from Oberon to his allies, regenerating health over time.

fourth.name: Reckoning
fourth.desc: Quickly lifts enemies into the air and then hurls them down with conviction. Enemies who succumb to this power have a chance to spawn a Health Sphere.

name: Octavia
description: This is Octavia, the melodic, the maestro. If music be the food of death... play on, Tenno.

passive.description: Octavia creates musical masterpieces from the Mandachord affixed to her arms that empowers her abilities. Casting any ability will inspire Octavia and nearby allies with her music, granting the Inspiration buff that replenishes 1 energy per second for 30 seconds. Allies within 15 meters will receive the Inspiration buff.

first.name: Mallet
first.desc: Rhythmically beats damage into nearby enemies and draws their fire. Damage inflicted on the Mallet increases its lethality.

second.name: Resonator
second.desc: Launches a rollerball that charms foes to follow it. Combines with the Mallet to create a roving ball of sonic destruction.

third.name: Metronome
third.desc: Grants buffs to those who consistently perform actions in time to Octavia’s music. Timed jumps offer the Vivace speed buff. Crouching on the beat grants cloaking with the Nocturne buff. Firing rhythmically bestows Opera multishot buff. Timed melee swings give the Forte damage buff.

fourth.name: Amp
fourth.desc: Draws power from the decibel level of sound in the area and uses it to amplify a damage buff for Octavia and her allies. It also doubles the damage and range of nearby Mallets.

name: Protea
description: Armed for deadly encounters, she is tactical and timely. This is Protea, the protector, the enforcer.

passive.description: After casting three abilities, Protea empowers her next ability cast with an additive 100% Ability Strength bonus.

first.name: Grenade Fan
first.desc: Throw out 3 grenades in an arc. (TAP) Creates a slashing, staggering swirl of shrapnel. (HOLD) Protea reconfigures 3 Grenades to work as overcharging shield generators, protecting her, her allies and companions. When Shields break a Satellite is destroyed to extend the period of invulnerability.

second.name: Blaze Artillery
second.desc: Deploys an artillery unit to blast plasma charges at enemies it faces. Each enemy hit increases the power of subsequent plasma attacks.

third.name: Dispensary
third.desc: Deploys a device that generates 3 pickups after a short delay: empowered health orb, universal ammo pack and energy orb.

fourth.name: Temporal Anchor
fourth.desc: Drops a Temporal Anchor which, after a short duration, Protea rewinds to triggering a temporal implosion. Implosion damage increases based on damage dealt between anchor drop and rewind. Everything lost or expended in that time is returned. Dying while Anchor is active rewinds Protea to the anchor, saving her. Protea is knocked down and the anchor vanishes.

name: Revenant
description: This is Revenant, the returned - the condemned. Harnessing the essence of Eidolon and warrior alike, he mystifies and obliterates his foes. Revenant serves last rites for the souls he leaves on fire, without a plea for mercy.

passive.description: Harnessing the essence of Eidolons, Revenant is immune to the Magnetic night waters of the Plains of Eidolon. Additionally, when his Shield depletes, Revenant emits a 100 damage radial Blast that knocks down enemies within 7.5m. There is a max 75% Damage Falloff at the edge of the blast's radius.

first.name: Enthrall
first.desc: Convert a target into a zealous thrall. Thralls turn on their allies and enthrall through damage. On death, they disintegrate into a damaging pillar of energy. The thrall horde remains under Revenant’s spell until this Ability runs out.

second.name: Mesmer Skin
second.desc: Become enveloped in Sentient energy, which redirects damage and stuns all those who dare attack. Stunned enemies can be Enthralled at no energy cost.

third.name: Reave
third.desc: Dash through enemies as a wall of Sentient energy, leeching shields and health from any encountered, enhanced for thralls.

fourth.name: Danse Macabre
fourth.desc: Erupt with a multitude of Eidolon energy beams and sweep a circle of death around Revenant. The beams will modify their Damage Type to target select defenses, while incoming damage is redirected back into the beams. Hold fire to boost Status Effects and Damage, at the cost of increased energy consumption. Thralls killed by this leave overshield pickups.

name: Rhino
description: This is Rhino, an immovable force and highly resilient. Rhino can survive alone or become the cornerstone of any squad, Tenno. The choice is yours.

passive.description: If Rhino falls far enough to incur a Hard Landing, the ground impact will discharge a shockwave that deals Impact damage in a 6 meter area of effect and knocking down nearby enemies.

first.name: Rhino Charge
first.desc: Rhino charges towards a target, clobbering any in his path and goring his victim.

second.name: Iron Skin
second.desc: Rhino hardens his skin, insulating himself from all damage.

third.name: Roar
third.desc: Grants all nearby Warframes increased damage for a short duration.

fourth.name: Rhino Stomp
fourth.desc: Rhino stomps with force sufficient to disrupt time, tumbling enemies around him in stasis.

name: Saryn
description: This is Saryn, elusive and deadly. Saryn is a deadly force on the battlefield. Get down with the sickness, Tenno.

passive.description: Status Effects inflicted by Saryn's weapons and abilities last 25% longer.

first.name: Spores
first.desc: Inflict a target with a pox of DmgCorrosiveSmall64.pngCorrosive spores. Spread spores to nearby enemies by destroying them or killing their host. The longer the Spore spreads, its damage will increase.

second.name: Molt
second.desc: Shedding her skin like a snake, Saryn leaves a decoy behind to draw fire from enemies.

third.name: Toxic Lash
third.desc: While active, attacks deal additional Toxin damage; this effect is doubled for melee strikes. Instantly burst spores when attacking afflicted enemies.

fourth.name: Miasma
fourth.desc: Releases a poisonous miasma that deals Viral damage to enemies in range. Foes afflicted by spores are more susceptible to the mist.

name: Sevagoth
description: He is the reason to fear the darkness, where his ethereal presence shakes loose the mortal coil. This is Sevagoth, the reaper, the specter of death. Do not seek death, Tenno, for Sevagoth may find you. Will you live to tell his tale?

passive.description: Intertwined forever in life and death, Sevagoth and his Shadow exhibit numerous unique properties and interactions.

first.name: Reap
first.desc: Sevagoth’s Shadow flies outward ravaging enemies in his path. Survivors are damaged by Death’s Harvest over time. The souls of the dead fill the Death Well.

second.name: Sow
second.desc: Plant a death seed in nearby targets to drain their lifeforce. Reap what has been sown to detonate afflicted enemies, dealing a percentage of their health as radial damage. The souls of the dead fill the Death Well.

third.name: Gloom
third.desc: Summon a radial pulse wave that ensnares and slows enemies, siphoning their lifeforce for the Death Well. Allies within the wave steal health with each attack.

fourth.name: Exalted Shadow
fourth.desc: When the Death Well fills to above 75%, Sevagoth’s Shadow form is ready to be released. Tear the enemy asunder with a collection of Melee-focused Abilities.

name: Styanax
description: Embody the valiant pride of ancient champions past, brandishing shield and spear zealously honed by ageless strife. Relive the legendary mythos of Styanax, the indomitable peltast.

passive.description: Styanax's weapon Critical Chance bonus increases by 1% per 40 Shield points, based on his current total including Overshields. Passive bonus is doubled on Speargun primary Weapons.

first.name: Axios Javelin
first.desc: Throw an Axios Javelin. When the javelin impales an enemy against a wall, surrounding enemies are pulled into the area and suffer a burst of damage.

second.name: Tharros Strike
second.desc: Summon Tharros, the shield of Styanax. Swing Tharros to repel enemies and reduce their shields and armor. Styanax regenerates health for every enemy struck.

third.name: Rally Point
third.desc: Draw enemy attention to Styanax. His resolve uplifts nearby allies, regenerating the squad’s energy over time. Styanax and his allies also regenerate shields for every kill assist they contribute.

fourth.name: Final Stand
fourth.desc: Exude might and valor. Rise into the air and throw a barrage of Axios Javelins. The javelins deal damage to nearby enemies wherever they land. Direct hits to enemies deal greater damage.

name: Titania
description: This is Titania, the pixie, the unseen. Titania is a deadly and mischievous addition to any squad, but don't take my word for it Tenno.

passive.description: Frolicking and fluttering about, Titania passively possesses +25% Bullet Jump and Rolling distance. Casting her abilities rejuvenates Titania and her allies within 15 meters, granting them the Upsurge buff which regenerates 4 Health points per second for 20 seconds.

first.name: Spellbind
first.desc: Enemies fumble their weapons as they tumble into the air. Nearby allies become immune to Status Effects.

second.name: Tribute
second.desc: Cycle through and extract one of the four Buffs when cast on an enemy. Thorns reduces incoming damage. Dust degrades enemy accuracy. Full Moon increases companion damage. Entangle slows enemies within range.

third.name: Lantern
third.desc: Create a swarm of razorflies that transform an enemy into an irresistible floating beacon, attracting witless comrades and finally exploding.

fourth.name: Razorwing
fourth.desc: Shrink down and take flight, while razorflies attack nearby enemies.

name: Trinity
description: This is Trinity, the healer, the equalizer. Trinity is a must for any high-stakes mission. She'll save your life, Tenno.

passive.description: Revive fallen allies 25% faster and from 50% farther away.

first.name: Well of Life
first.desc: Create a well of life on an enemy. Allies will gain health when damaging the target.

second.name: Energy Vampire
second.desc: Allies will gain energy over time when enemies are marked with Energy Vampire.

third.name: Link
third.desc: Any damage taken while Link is active will be channeled to a nearby enemy.

fourth.name: Blessing
fourth.desc: Restore the health and shields of allies within Trinity's Affinity aura while giving them some damage immunity.

name: Valkyr
description: This is Valkyr, the tormented, the experiment. Valkyr was crafted from torment, Tenno. Take control of her rage.

passive.description: Valkyr is nimble, able to recover from knockdown 50% faster and is immune to Hard Landings, landing with no touchdown delay.

first.name: Rip Line
first.desc: Valkyr hurls forth a hook. If it hits an enemy, she pulls them to her. If it hits terrain, she pulls herself to the hook's location.

second.name: Warcry
second.desc: Valkyr lets out a rallying cry that bolsters her allies melee speed while slowing down nearby enemies.

third.name: Paralysis
third.desc: Valkyr unleashes her shields, stunning and damaging enemies around her.

fourth.name: Hysteria
fourth.desc: Valkyr is imbued with energy and becomes a ball of vicious rage, capable of unleashing a torrent of deadly claw attacks on unsuspecting foes.

name: Vauban
description: This is Vauban, focused and methodical. Vauban willingly sacrificed his own safety in the name of mayhem. Use him wisely, Tenno.

passive.description: An inventor by nature, the process of creation necessitates demolition and deconstruction. Vauban inflicts 25% extra damage with his weapons and abilities, against enemies that are incapacitated and unable to move.

first.name: Tesla Nervos
first.desc: Deploy a roller drone that attaches itself to enemies and delivers bursts of arcing electricity to anything in the immediate area.

second.name: Minelayer
second.desc: Cycle through four deployable mines: Tether Coil, Flechette Orb, Vector Pad and Overdriver.

third.name: Photon Strike
third.desc: Drop a targeting beacon that calls in a devastating laser artillery strike.

fourth.name: Bastille
fourth.desc: Erect a containment field to capture enemies and suspended them in stasis, stripping their armor. Hold to collapse all Bastilles into a single damaging vortex.

name: Volt
description: This is Volt, a versatile warrior. Volt's arsenal is powerful and electrifying. Handle with care, Tenno.

passive.description: Traveling along the ground between Volt's attacks (by walking, running, or sliding) will build up static energy, adding bonus Electricity damage toward Volt's next weapon attack or ability cast.

first.name: Shock
first.desc: Launches a shocking projectile. It stuns and deals high damage to a single target and chains damage to nearby enemies.

second.name: Speed
second.desc: Volt energizes his body and nearby Warframes, giving them increased speed and dexterity for a short time.

third.name: Electric Shield
third.desc: Volt deploys an obstacle of energy, providing cover in any situation.

fourth.name: Discharge
fourth.desc: Paralyze nearby hostiles with a damaging electric charge, this also shocks approaching enemies.

name: Voruna
description: Beware the telltale bloodcurdling howl when the primeval hunt begins anew. Nightfall engulfs the hallowed moonlit shrine, where sacred beasts of claw and fang prowl. Heed the wolven queen, Voruna, here she decrees her midnight feast.

passive.description: Like a blood moon striding across the starlit night, Voruna never hunts alone. Safeguarded by her four loyal wolves, she may freely invoke their protective passives anytime during a mission.

first.name: Shroud of Dynar
first.desc: (TAP) Dynar shrouds Voruna with invisibility and accelerates her speed. Invisibility ends when Voruna attacks. For a short time, melee attacks have increased Critical Damage and Status Chance and inflict Bleed. Melee kill an enemy during this time to extend the buff. (HOLD) Dynar guards Voruna, increasing her Parkour Velocity.

second.name: Fangs of Raksh
second.desc: (TAP) Raksh's fangs tear into your enemies. 5 random Status Effects are applied at 10 Stacks each on an enemy. On target's death, spread the Status Effects to other nearby enemies. (HOLD) Raksh guards Voruna with Status Effect resistance.

third.name: Lycath's Hunt
third.desc: (TAP) Lycath hunts to sustain the pack. There is a chance for enemies killed by melee attacks to drop health orbs and enemies killed by headshots to supply energy orbs. Increase the duration of Lycath's hunt by killing enemies affected by 5 or more Status Effects. (HOLD) Lycath guards Voruna with increased Heavy Attack efficiency.

fourth.name: Ulfrun's Descent
fourth.desc: (TAP) Voruna drops to all fours and prepares 5 brutal charges that lock onto enemies. Ulfrun, the most powerful wolf, leads the attack as Voruna dashes toward her target. The pack deals increased damage to targets and nearby enemies that are inflicted by Status Effects. Lethal attacks double the damage of Voruna’s remaining charges. (HOLD) Ulfrun guards Voruna. If Voruna falls during this time, Ulfrun dies in her place.

name: Wisp
description: Invisible in the air and swift on the ground, she moves like the wind. This is Wisp. Summoner of the ethereal. Her grace is only balanced by her destruction. Do not get lost in its wake, Tenno.

passive.description: Wisp weaves between dimensions whilst she is airborne, gaining a cloak that renders her and her Companions completely invisible to enemies until she lands or fires a weapon. Wisp's cloak will reactivate briefly after the player stops firing provided they are still airborne.

first.name: Reservoirs
first.desc: Choose and summon a Reservoir filled with Motes that attach to and aid Wisp and her allies. Haste Mote grants increased movement and attack speed. Vitality Mote increases maximum health and heals over time. Shock Mote stuns nearby enemies.

second.name: Wil-O-Wisp
second.desc: Cast forward a spectral image of Wisp to confuse and distract enemies. Reactivate to travel to its position. Hold to have the image travel faster and teleport to its position on release.

third.name: Breach Surge
third.desc: Open a dimensional breach to overwhelm nearby enemies and cause them to release aggressive Surge sparks when damaged. Wisp may also target a Reservoir to teleport to it and double the range of the surge.

fourth.name: Sol Gate
fourth.desc: Open a portal to the sun to irradiate enemies with a devastating beam of pure solar plasma.

name: Wukong
description: This is Wukong, the enduring, the swift. Everybody's got something to hide, Tenno. Except Wukong.

passive.description: Wukong has learned five techniques to avoid death whenever he takes fatal damage. Wukong will be randomly allowed 3 of these techniques per mission to avoid death 3 times. Each technique will make Wukong avoid entering bleedout upon taking fatal damage, invulnerable for 2 seconds, restore 50% health, and provide a unique buff.

first.name: Celestial Twin
first.desc: Shedding part of himself, Wukong creates a twin to fight by his side. Attack at range and the twin will melee, pull a blade and the twin will lay down covering fire. Use again to command the twin to attack a target with increased damage.

second.name: Cloud Walker
second.desc: Evaporate into a cloud of mist and float through the battlefield, dazing any enemy encountered, while healing Wukong and his twin.

third.name: Defy
third.desc: Wukong and his twin become invulnerable and defy enemies to attack. All damage is captured, stored, and dealt back in a single furious strike of Wukong's staff. Bonus Armor is then granted relative to the damage captured.

fourth.name: Primal Fury
fourth.desc: Summon the Iron Staff and unleash fury.

name: Xaku
description: Forged from the remnants of lost Warframes, they channel the spirits of the Void. This is Xaku, the fragmented, the restored. In the concert of mayhem, Xaku is a law unto themselves, Tenno.

passive.description: Shifting their pieces unpredictably, Xaku has a 25% Dodge chance to harmlessly phase through incoming enemy weapon attacks, while protected by a 25% Damage Reduction against area of effect damage. Passive dodge chance and area damage reduction both raise to 75% while The Vast Untime is activated.

first.name: Xata's Whisper
first.desc: Wield Void damage for all attacks from equipped weapons when activated.

second.name: Grasp of Lohk
second.desc: Void Tendrils steal weapons from nearby enemies to use as your own floating, auto-targeting armament.

third.name: The Lost
third.desc: Cycle through and cast one of the three abilities originating from the Warframes that make up Xaku: Accuse, Gaze, and Deny.

fourth.name: The Vast Untime
fourth.desc: Temporarily shed the outer pieces of Xaku in a destructive blast, then stalk the battlefield in a new, swifter skeletal form. Enemies damaged by the body shrapnel are rendered weaker to Void damage.

name: Yareli
description: She is the one to give hope to the hopeless, defeating her enemies with her aquatic grace. This is Yareli, the selfless, the wave rider. Yareli fights for those who need it most, and strikes fear into those who oppress. Do you dream of water, Tenno?

passive.description: Everflowing with the seas, whenever Yareli moves for at least 1.5 seconds, she gains the Critical Flow buff that increases Critical Chance on her secondary Weapon by 200%. Critical Flow lasts until Yareli stops moving for 1 second.

first.name: Sea Snares
first.desc: Form three water globules that seek out enemies and expand on contact, simultaneously damaging and immobilizing their victims.

second.name: Merulina
second.desc: Summon Merulina, a rideable creature of the waves, and the inspiration for K-Driving. Merulina protects Yareli by absorbing a large portion of incoming damage.

third.name: Aquablades
third.desc: Tear through foes with a trio of orbiting aquatic blades.

fourth.name: Riptide
fourth.desc: Drag enemies into a crushing maelstrom and then blow them away in a watery burst. Each enemy trapped in the vortex increases the burst's Damage.

name: Zephyr
description: This is Zephyr, light, yet deceivingly lethal. Zephyr brings graceful destruction to the battlefield. Look up, Tenno.

passive.description: Zephyr moves faster and falls slower while airborne. Also gain 150% Critical Hit chance with weapons while airborne.

first.name: Tail Wind
first.desc: Hold while airborne to hover Zephyr with reduced movement. From the air, tap to dash forward, or aim down to dive bomb enemies below.

second.name: Airburst
second.desc: Launch a burst of massively dense air. Hold to send enemies flying, tap to pull them toward the burst. Damage increases per enemy hit.

third.name: Turbulence
third.desc: Creates a wind shield around Zephyr, redirecting all incoming projectiles.

fourth.name: Tornado
fourth.desc: Create deadly tornadoes that seek out and engulf enemies. Tornadoes deal the elemental damage type they absorb the most. Shoot enemies engulfed in Tornadoes to do additional damage.

name: Ash Prime
description: Distraction and subterfuge become lethal weapons with Ash Prime. Featuring altered mod polarities for greater customization.

passive.description: Slash procs inflicted by Ash's weapons and abilities deal 25% more damage and last 50% longer.

first.name: Shuriken
first.desc: Launches a spinning blade of pain, dealing high damage and impaling enemies to walls.

second.name: Smoke Screen
second.desc: Drops a smoke bomb that stuns enemies and obscures their vision, rendering Ash invisible for a short time.

third.name: Teleport
third.desc: Ash teleports towards the target, bringing him into melee range and making enemies vulnerable to finishers.

fourth.name: Bladestorm
fourth.desc: Project fierce shadow clones of Ash upon groups of distant enemies. Join the fray using Teleport.

name: Atlas Prime
description: In bygone ages, mountains were said to house warriors. In this age, the mountain has become the warrior.

passive.description: Wielding explosive power and incredible stamina, Atlas strengthens his insurmountable durability through battle. Strong as the mountain, Atlas is immune to Knockdown while in contact with the ground. Rubble is a pickup item unique to Atlas that drops from petrified enemies and Rumblers on death. Rubble restores Health to Atlas if he is injured; if Atlas is at full health, Rubble instead grants additional Armor that decays over time.

first.name: Landslide
first.desc: Bash enemies with an exploding sliding punch, and repeat for a devastating combo. Petrified enemies take extra damage, and drop Rubble when destroyed. Rubble can heal Atlas and bolster his armor.

second.name: Tectonics
second.desc: Summon a rock-wall, activate again to send the rocks crashing towards the enemy.

third.name: Petrify
third.desc: Atlas' hardened gaze will fossilize foes, heal Rumblers, and create Petrified Bulwarks. When shattered, petrified enemies drop healing Rubble for Atlas.

fourth.name: Rumblers
fourth.desc: Summon two elemental stone brawlers to the melee. Summoning petrifies enemies in close proximity to Atlas. When finished, Rumblers collapse into a pile of healing Rubble.

name: Banshee Prime
description: Banshee Prime assails her foes by manipulating sonic forces to deadly effect. Featuring altered mod polarities for greater customization.

passive.description: All of Banshee's equipped weapons, including Gunblades, and weapons equipped on Sentinels should they be present, are treated as silent.

first.name: Sonic Boom
first.desc: Banshee emits a sonic shockwave that pushes targets in range with enough force to incapacitate or kill attackers.

second.name: Sonar
second.desc: Using acoustic location, Banshee's Sonar power finds and tracks enemies, and exposes critical weak spots to everyone in your squad.

third.name: Silence
third.desc: Using Silence surrounds Banshee in an aura that stuns enemies and will limit their perceptions and tactical response to gunfire and Warframe attacks.

fourth.name: Sound Quake
fourth.desc: Channeling all of her acoustic energy into the environment, Banshee uses ultrasonic reverberations to violently shake the ground.

name: Baruuk Prime
description: Doomed are the fools who attack the peace and exhaust the restraint of this reluctant warrior.

passive.description: Baruuk's tolerance for violence wanes as his hand is forced by his foes. Restraint is a resource unique to Baruuk that provides up to 50% Damage Reduction when the meter is completely depleted.

first.name: Elude
first.desc: Dodge all incoming projectiles, but only while not attacking. Use again to deactivate this ability.

second.name: Lull
second.desc: A calming wave slows enemies until they fall into a slumber. Enemies woken by damage will be confused and disoriented. Short-term amnesia means all waking enemies forget anything that happened before the lull.

third.name: Desolate Hands
third.desc: Summon a bevy of orbiting daggers to seek out enemy guns, destroying them with a small explosion. Combine with Elude to double the range.

fourth.name: Serene Storm
fourth.desc: With his Restraint eroded, Baruuk commands the Desert Wind to deliver powerful radial strikes with his fists and feet. Each moment commanding the storm restores his Restraint.

name: Chroma Prime
description: Bind the elements and unleash untold destruction with Chroma Prime. Featuring altered mod polarities for greater customization.

passive.description: Chroma possesses an extra midair jump and bullet jump. Wings matching Chroma's energy colors will form during these maneuvers. Chroma can alter his abilities to match any basic (uncombined) elemental attribute of the player's choice. Customizing Chroma's primary emission color determines what abilities he starts with.

first.name: Spectral Scream
first.desc: Exhale a deep breath of elemental destruction. Chroma's energy color determines the element.

second.name: Elemental Ward
second.desc: Depending on Chroma's elemental alignment, an offensive area-of-effect is created. Chroma and his nearby allies are imbued with defensive energy.

third.name: Vex Armor
third.desc: When shields are hit, Chroma's armor grows stronger, when health takes a hit, weapon damage increases. Active for a limited time, maximum increases correspond to rank.

fourth.name: Effigy
fourth.desc: Chroma turns his pelt into a massive sentry that strengthens nearby allies and engulfs enemies in elemental attacks.

name: Ember Prime
description: Ember Prime offers the same potential for wanton destruction as Ember but provides unique mod polarities, allowing for greater customization.

passive.description: Reveling in the heat of combat, Ember gains 5% extra Ability Strength for every enemy burning with an active Heat status effect within a 50 meters radius.

first.name: Fireball
first.desc: Charge and release a fiery projectile that ignites enemies on contact.

second.name: Immolation
second.desc: Protect Ember with flame armor that burns stronger over time, consuming energy once its meter is at full strength. Cast again to extinguish the flame.

third.name: Fire Blast
third.desc: Slam the ground to create a wave of incinerating plasma that knocks back enemies and strips their armor.

fourth.name: Inferno
fourth.desc: Command a flaming comet to crash down in front of ember, engulfing enemies with a fire that can spread through their ranks.

name: Equinox Prime
description: Night and Day in final balance; the graceful perfection of the one that walks the borders.

passive.description: When Equinox collects Health Orbs or Energy Orbs, 10% of the restored amount is converted into additional Energy and Health respectively. Equinox can shift between two forms to alter her abilities: the offensive-focused Day-Form or the defensive/supportive-focused Night-Form. Customizing Equinox's primary emission color determines what form she starts with.

first.name: Metamorphosis
first.desc: Switch forms, temporarily gaining bonus shields and armor in Night-Form, or bonus damage and speed in Day-Form.

second.name: Rest & Rage
second.desc: In Night Form targets are put to sleep. In Day Form targets become more vulnerable to damage.

third.name: Pacify & Provoke
third.desc: In Night Form reduces damage inflicted by nearby enemies. In Day Form increases Ability Strength of nearby allies.

fourth.name: Mend & Maim
fourth.desc: In Night Form, allies are healed with each nearby enemy killed. In Day Form, nearby enemies are bled and then subjected to a wave of slashing force.

name: Excalibur Prime
description: Excalibur Prime is the epitome of mobility and offense, and features the same abilities as Excalibur, but has unique mod polarities installed allowing for greater customization.

passive.description: Excalibur has improved mastery in the Tenno art of the blade, receiving +10% Attack Speed and +10% damage bonuses for melee attacks while wielding the following weapons: Swords, Dual swords, Nikanas, Rapiers, Exalted Blade.

first.name: Slash Dash
first.desc: Dash between enemies while slashing with the Exalted Blade.

second.name: Radial Blind
second.desc: Emits a bright flash of light, blinding all enemies in a small radius for several seconds.

third.name: Radial Javelin
third.desc: Launches javelins towards enemies, dealing high damage and impaling them to walls.

fourth.name: Exalted Blade
fourth.desc: Summon a sword of pure light and immense power.

name: Frost Prime
description: Frost Prime has the same chilling abilities as Frost but provides unique mod polarities, allowing for greater customization.

passive.description: Any melee assailant that strikes Frost has a 10% chance to be temporarily frozen for 20 seconds on impact.

first.name: Freeze
first.desc: A frigid energy blast that freezes targets in their tracks.

second.name: Ice Wave
second.desc: Sends a wave of razor sharp, crystallized ice toward an enemy, dealing heavy damage.

third.name: Snow Globe
third.desc: Frost deep freezes any vapor and moisture in the area, creating a protective sphere with brief invulnerability to boost its strength.

fourth.name: Avalanche
fourth.desc: Summons a treacherous landslide of ice that instantly freezes and shatters all enemies in its radius.

name: Gara Prime
description: This is Gara, the unbreakable warrior. Manipulator of glass, she fractures the resolve of her enemies. The shattered remains of her enemies are all that Gara leaves behind. Tread lightly.

passive.description: While standing in light, Gara's glass body has a chance to blind enemies within 12 meters for 10 seconds, exposing them to Melee Finisher attacks.

first.name: Shattered Lash
first.desc: Lash out with stream of shattered glass, or hold for an arcing strike.

second.name: Splinter Storm
second.desc: Gara's armor splinters into a maelstrom of shattered glass that slices enemies and impairs their weapons. Allies who contact the cloud are fortified against damage.

third.name: Spectrorage
third.desc: Trap enemies in a carousel of mirrors, forcing them to attack visions of their true selves. Destroyed mirrors damage their attackers, as does the collapse of the carousel.

fourth.name: Mass Vitrify
fourth.desc: Create an expanding ring of molten glass that slowly crystallizes enemies who enter. When the expansion is complete, the ring hardens to block weapons fire. The ring draws extra strength from the health and shields of crystallized enemies. Use Shattered Lash to smash the ring and send razor-sharp glass flying outward.

name: Garuda Prime
description: White, gold and deepest scarlet, the queen of gore in full regalia.

passive.description: The more Garuda kills the more vicious her attacks become; Garuda gains up to 100% additional damage bonus for her abilities and weapons for each kill or assisted kill.  When no melee weapon is selected in the Arsenal loadout, Garuda Talons become available in the Arsenal screen as an exclusive melee weapon that can be modified separately and equipped for combat during missions.

first.name: Dread Mirror
first.desc: Rip the life force from an enemy and use it as a shield that captures damage. Charge to channel the captured damage into an explosive projectile.

second.name: Blood Altar
second.desc: Impale an enemy on an altar of talons and siphon health for Garuda and her allies.

third.name: Bloodletting
third.desc: Garuda sacrifices her health to generate energy.

fourth.name: Seeking Talons
fourth.desc: Charge to expand the targeting area, release to send Garuda’s talons careening toward each target in area. Surviving enemies are prone to bleeding.

name: Harrow Prime
description: The Inquisitor Eternal arises, hallowed by the Void, preaching a gospel of iron and flame.

passive.description: Harrow possesses 200% Overshields capacity, granting him a maximum of 2,400 Overshields, and spawns into missions with 100% Energy filled.

first.name: Condemn
first.desc: Cast a wave of energy that chains them where they stand. Each enemy held reinforces Harrow’s shields.

second.name: Penance
second.desc: Sacrifice shields to boost reload, and fire rate while converting damage inflicted on enemies into health for Harrow and nearby allies.

third.name: Thurible
third.desc: Channel Harrow’s energy into the Thurible to generate a buff. Once finished, kill enemies to bestow nearby allies with bursts of energy. The more energy channeled the greater the reward for each kill. Headshots produce extra energy.

fourth.name: Covenant
fourth.desc: Protect nearby allies with an energy force that absorbs all damage and converts it to a Critical Chance bonus for all those under the Covenant. Headshots are amplified even further.

name: Hydroid Prime
description: Command the ocean's fury with this king of gold and silver. Featuring altered mod polarities for greater customization.

passive.description: Hydroid's melee slam attacks have a 50% chance to spawn a tentacle that lasts for 15 seconds. The tentacle senses nearby enemies within 5 meters to grab and thrash them, dealing 200 True damage per second bypassing shields and armor; captured enemies are released upon death or tentacle expiring. Up to 3 tentacles spawned by this passive may exist at once.

first.name: Tempest Barrage
first.desc: Target an area and call down a barrage of liquid fury. Charge this attack to increase the lethality of the onslaught.

second.name: Tidal Surge
second.desc: Crash through enemies in a ferocious wall of water.

third.desc: Become a water trap and drown unsuspecting enemies.

fourth.desc: Tap to spawn watery tentacles from all nearby surfaces to wreak havoc. Charge to increase the number of tentacles and spawn area. Use while in Undertow to have the tentacles emerge from the pool.

name: Inaros Prime
description: Rise, eternal, to cast the fear of Inaros into them. Featuring altered mod polarities for greater customization.

passive.description: Resurrect the undying king of the desert with the death of his foes. On fatal injury and entering Bleedout, Inaros enters an immobile Sarcophagus. Within his tomb, target an enemy or ally on the aiming reticle (default LMB ) to release a beam that continuously inflicts 75 True damage per tick and siphon hitpoints from them, gradually filling his revive meter to allow Inaros to rise again. Killing enemies with melee Finishers restores 20% of Inaros' maximum Health.

first.name: Desiccation
first.desc: Blast enemies with a wave of cursed sand that blinds them and steals their health.

second.name: Devour
second.desc: Hold power to trap target in quicksand and draw them in for devouring; this steals health and ultimately creates a friendly Sand Shadow.

third.name: Sandstorm
third.desc: Become a whirling spiral of sand that sends enemies flying and devours those trapped in quicksand.

fourth.name: Scarab Swarm
fourth.desc: Charge to transform health into hardened scarab armor. Discharge to blast enemies with a scarab swarm; survivors have their health drained and bestowed on allies.

name: Ivara Prime
description: As regal and lethal as a nighttime wood, this is the queen of the hunt in her ultimate form.

passive.description: Ivara has an innate radar that detects enemies within 20 meters and displays their position on the minimap.

first.name: Quiver
first.desc: Cycle through and shoot one of four tactical arrows: Cloak, Dashwire, Noise and Sleep.

second.name: Navigator
second.desc: Assume control of a projectile and guide it to the target.

third.name: Prowl
third.desc: Become invisible and steal loot from unsuspecting enemies or take out prey with deadly headshots.

fourth.name: Artemis Bow
fourth.desc: Summon a mighty bow and unleash a volley of devastating arrows.

name: Khora Prime
description: A harmony of mistress and monster. The gilded huntress and her loyal Kavat, Venari, dominate the battlefield with their will.

passive.description: Khora's ferocious Kavat, Venari, fights alongside her with steadfast zeal. Venari is an exclusive Companion for the Khora Warframe, integrated as her signature passive ability. Venari will spawn beside Khora when the player first enters a mission, as a permanent companion that lasts until killed.

first.name: Whipclaw
first.desc: Send enemies reeling with a deafening whipcrack.

second.name: Ensnare
second.desc: Bind a hapless target in living metal, entangling others who stray too close. Whipclaw will refresh the trap allowing it to capture more enemies.

third.name: Venari
third.desc: Command Venari to focus on a target. Hold to cycle between Attack, Protect, and Heal postures. If Venari is killed, use this ability to revive her instantly.

fourth.name: Strangledome
fourth.desc: Weave a dome of living chain that ensnares and strangles any enemy within, and any foolish enough to approach. Foes outside the trap will try to hasten their comrade's deaths by shooting them. Crack Whipclaw on the dome to further damage any trapped enemies.

name: Limbo Prime
description: Dance between realms with this golden rift walker. Featuring altered mod polarities for greater customization.

passive.description: Limbo has access to the Rift plane (Rift for short), an alternate dimension to the normal environment, or material plane. By performing a Roll, a Sidespring, or a Backspring, Limbo slides into and out of the Rift at will. This is better known as Rift Walk. Several of Limbo's abilities impose the Rift upon the world around him, affecting himself, the environment, enemies, and even allies.

first.name: Banish
first.desc: Casts a wave of Rift energy that damages hostiles while pushing enemies and allies out of Limbo’s current plane of existence.

second.name: Stasis
second.desc: Freezes Rift-bound enemies. While active, enemy projectiles are arrested in mid-air, resuming its trajectory when stasis ends.

third.name: Rift Surge
third.desc: Surges nearby Rift-bound enemies with Rift energy. When killed the Rift Surge is transferred to a nearby enemy outside the rift. Surged enemies that leave the Rift perform a radial Banish.

fourth.name: Cataclysm
fourth.desc: A violent blast of void energy tears open a pocket of rift plane which can sustain itself for a short period before collapsing in another lethal blast.

name: Loki Prime
description: Confuse, deceive and destroy with Loki Prime. Featuring altered mod polarities for greater customization.

passive.description: Loki's Wall Latch duration lasts 10 times longer than normal, up to a maximum of 60 seconds.

first.name: Decoy
first.desc: Loki deploys a holographic copy of himself, drawing enemy fire.

second.name: Invisibility
second.desc: Loki camouflages himself, becoming invisible to enemies.

third.name: Switch Teleport
third.desc: Loki instantaneously swaps positions with a target, confusing the enemy.

fourth.name: Radial Disarm
fourth.desc: Lets forth a wave of energy, disrupting the projectile weapons of enemies in range and forcing them to revert to melee combat.

name: Mag Prime
description: The exquisite Mag Prime offers the same abilities as Mag but with unique mod polarities for greater customization.

passive.description: Mag automatically Vacuums Pickups that are within 8 meters towards her.

first.name: Pull
first.desc: Magnetic force pulls enemies toward you, stunning them and bringing them into melee range.

second.name: Magnetize
second.desc: (TAP) Encloses a target in a magnetic field, ensnaring nearby enemies and dealing damage over time. Bullets and shards created from Polarize increase this damage. (HOLD) Creates a magnetic field around a target, ensnaring nearby enemies and dealing damage over time. The field reacts to bullets and shards created from Polarize to increase the damage.

third.name: Polarize
third.desc: Emit an energy pulse that depletes enemy shields and armor, creating shards which become deadly when mixed with Magnetize. Shields of allies touched by the pulse are restored.

fourth.name: Crush
fourth.desc: Magnetizes the bones of nearby enemies, causing them to collapse upon themselves.

name: Mesa Prime
description: Cast a long shadow with this lethal enforcer. Featuring altered mod polarities for greater customization.

passive.description: Mesa has improved proficiency with secondary weapons, and gains a health bonus at the expense of not having a melee weapon equipped. The following are passive bonuses available to Mesa: +15% fire rate with dual wielded sidearms, +25% reload speed for one handed sidearms, +50 health when no melee weapon is equipped.

first.name: Ballistic Battery
first.desc: When activated, this power stores damage caused by guns. When triggered again, that damage is channeled through the next gunshot.

second.name: Shooting Gallery
second.desc: Gives an ally extra damage while jamming the guns of nearby enemies. This power shifts between team members.

third.name: Shatter Shield
third.desc: Envelops Mesa in a barrier of energy, reflecting back incoming bullet damage.

fourth.name: Peacemaker
fourth.desc: With intense focus, Mesa draws her Regulator pistols, shooting down her foes in rapid succession.

name: Mirage Prime
description: Dazzle the opposition with this golden master of illusion and mayhem.

passive.description: Mirage has an increased proficiency when performing several Maneuvers. Sliding lasts 85% longer, +50% faster Maneuver speed.

first.name: Hall of Mirrors
first.desc: Mirage creates an entourage of doppelgangers to confuse and distract the enemy.

second.name: Sleight of Hand
second.desc: Booby trap nearby objects while conjuring an irresistible jewel that bursts with radial blind when touched in darkness, or a radial explosion in light. Conjure multiple smaller jewels with the help of Hall of Mirrors.

third.name: Eclipse
third.desc: Standing in light, Mirage deals heavy damage, while the shadows make Mirage difficult to track and even harder to hurt.

fourth.name: Prism
fourth.desc: Fires an energy prism that shoots lasers in all directions. Activating again detonates the prism, blinding nearby foes.
